comment: A really fun irish whisky. not so much butter and shortbread but more floral and a light sweetness which makes this go down very easy. 4.25
A limited edition. I am still figuring it out but I like it.
I actually prefer the 15yo over the 16yo offering. Granted my tastes run more towards the fruity end of the spectrum, but I find the 15 is much full flavored though both are eminently drinkable neat.

Nose : Fruity, but a little exotic. Vanilla, banana, orange, pear are the stars, but there is also mango and pineapple.

Taste : The exotic  fruits are still there, but they are hidden a bit by the malt. The sweetness of wine is felt after a bit.

Finish : A little more intense than the taste, it is lengthy and tasty. The wine cask finish is seen here, as it is quite dry in the end.
Rich raw oak, heather spice and a background of semi-dry dessert wine. $125 in Ontario.

N: Coffee, apples, nuttiness, a wisp of cigar smoke.

P: Green apples, berries, toffee, melon, mild black pepper.

F: Tart frutiness, a little bitter almond.

Very tasty, but not quite on par with Irishman 12 and nearly twice the cost.
Orange peel, vanilla, warm mouthfeel. Needs a little time to open up...first sip was harsh, but I really liked it 20 minutes later and the second dram.
Perfect notes of caramel and orange peel
Chocolate, caramel,  lots of fruit, bit of iodine, and oak. Wonderful mouthfeel.
